The 'culture of [[France]]' and of the French people has been shaped by
geography, by profound historical events, and by foreign and internal forces and
groups. France, and in particular Paris, has played an important role as a
center of high culture and of decorative arts since the 17th century, first in
Europe, and from the 19th century on, world wide. From the late 19th century,
France has also played an important role in cinema, fashion and cuisine. The
importance of French culture has waxed and waned over the centuries, depending
on its economic, political and military importance. French culture today is
marked both by great regional and socioeconomic differences and by strong
unifying tendencies.
